The desiderative śikṣ has won a so independent use and value that it might well enough have been treated (like bhakṣ etc.) as a separate root. R. divide śak (and śikṣ) into two roots, the second meaning 'help'. but favor their ultimate identity.
There are other groups of words, not connectable with this or any other verbal root: thus, śakuná, śakúni, śakúnta, śakúnti V.+; śáka, śakán, śákṛt V.+; śaṅkú V.+, śakti ('spear') E.+
